info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 11 at 7:01PM CDT until April 11 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN LOGAN...SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSON AND WEST CENTRAL POPE COUNTIES... At 700 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located near Knoxville, or 10 miles southeast of Clarksville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Lamar... London... Knoxville... Holman... Lake Dardanelle... Augsburg... Lutherville... Piney Bay Recreation Area... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 61 and 75. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
